paper_title.ja: *-HOMOMORPHISMS OF MATRIX ALGEBRAS OVER PSEUDO-SOLENOIDS THAT ARE APPROXIMATED BY *-ISOMORPHISMS
paper_title.en: *-HOMOMORPHISMS OF MATRIX ALGEBRAS OVER PSEUDO-SOLENOIDS THAT ARE APPROXIMATED BY *-ISOMORPHISMS

description.ja: A pseudo-solenoid is a compact connected metrizable space that is an inverse limit of circles and has a characteristic feature, called hereditary indecomposability. The class of pseudo-solenoids has a topological rigidity in that two pseudo-solenoids X and Y are homeomorphic if and only if their first integral ech cohomology groups are isomorphic. We show that the class of matrix algebras over pseudo-solenoids has a similar and only if they have isomorphic K1-groups.
description.en: A pseudo-solenoid is a compact connected metrizable space that is an inverse limit of circles and has a characteristic feature, called hereditary indecomposability. The class of pseudo-solenoids has a topological rigidity in that two pseudo-solenoids X and Y are homeomorphic if and only if their first integral ech cohomology groups are isomorphic. We show that the class of matrix algebras over pseudo-solenoids has a similar and only if they have isomorphic K1-groups.

paper_title.ja: Rational stabilization and maximal ideal spaces of commutative Banach algebras
paper_title.en: Rational stabilization and maximal ideal spaces of commutative Banach algebras

description.ja: For a unital commutative Banach algebra A and its closed ideal I, we study the relative Cech cohomology of the pair (Max(A), Max(A/I)) of maximal ideal spaces and show a relative version of the main theorem of Lupton et al. (Trans Amer Math Soc 361:267-296, 2009):. H-j (Max(A), Max(A/ I)); Q) congruent to pi(2n-j-1)(Lc(n)(I))(Q) for j < 2n - 1, where Lc(n)(I) refers to the space of last columns. We then study the rational cohomological dimension cdim(Q)Max(A) for a unital commutative Banach algebra and prove an embedding theorem: if A is a unital commutative semi-simple regular Banach algebra such that Max(A) is metrizable and cdimQMax(A) <= m, then (i) the rational homotopy group pi(k) (GLn(A))(Q) is stabilized if n >= inverted right perpendicular(m + k + 1)/2inverted left perpendicular and (ii) there exists a compact metrizable space X-A with dim X-A <= m such that A is embedded into the commutative C *-algebra C(X-A) such that pi(k) (GL(n)(C(X-A))) is rationally isomorphic to pi(k) (GL(n)(A)) for each k >= 1 and pi(k) (GL(n)(C(X-A)) is stabilized for inverted right perpendicularn >= (m + k + 1)/2inverted left perpendicular. The main technical ingredient is a modified version of a classical theorem of Davie (Proc Lond Math Soc 23:31-52, 1971).
description.en: For a unital commutative Banach algebra A and its closed ideal I, we study the relative Cech cohomology of the pair (Max(A), Max(A/I)) of maximal ideal spaces and show a relative version of the main theorem of Lupton et al. (Trans Amer Math Soc 361:267-296, 2009):. H-j (Max(A), Max(A/ I)); Q) congruent to pi(2n-j-1)(Lc(n)(I))(Q) for j < 2n - 1, where Lc(n)(I) refers to the space of last columns. We then study the rational cohomological dimension cdim(Q)Max(A) for a unital commutative Banach algebra and prove an embedding theorem: if A is a unital commutative semi-simple regular Banach algebra such that Max(A) is metrizable and cdimQMax(A) <= m, then (i) the rational homotopy group pi(k) (GLn(A))(Q) is stabilized if n >= inverted right perpendicular(m + k + 1)/2inverted left perpendicular and (ii) there exists a compact metrizable space X-A with dim X-A <= m such that A is embedded into the commutative C *-algebra C(X-A) such that pi(k) (GL(n)(C(X-A))) is rationally isomorphic to pi(k) (GL(n)(A)) for each k >= 1 and pi(k) (GL(n)(C(X-A)) is stabilized for inverted right perpendicularn >= (m + k + 1)/2inverted left perpendicular. The main technical ingredient is a modified version of a classical theorem of Davie (Proc Lond Math Soc 23:31-52, 1971).

paper_title.en: Non-contractible locally connected continua with trivial homotopy groups
paper_title.ja: Non-contractible locally connected continua with trivial homotopy groups

description.ja: We give a construction of a cell-like non-contractible LC infinity continuum which has trivial homotopy group in each dimension. This generalizes a previous construction given by Repovg and the first author. (C) 2020 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
description.en: We give a construction of a cell-like non-contractible LC infinity continuum which has trivial homotopy group in each dimension. This generalizes a previous construction given by Repovg and the first author. (C) 2020 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Inverse systems with simplicial bonding maps and cell structures
paper_title.ja: Inverse systems with simplicial bonding maps and cell structures

description.en: For a topologically complete space X and a family of closed covers A of X satisfying a "local refinement condition" and a "completeness condition," we give a construction of an inverse system N-A of simplicial complexes and simplicial bonding maps such that the limit space N-infinity = ($)under-left-arrow lim N-A is homotopy equivalent to X. A connection with cell structures [2], [3] is discussed. (C) 2021 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
description.ja: For a topologically complete space X and a family of closed covers A of X satisfying a "local refinement condition" and a "completeness condition," we give a construction of an inverse system N-A of simplicial complexes and simplicial bonding maps such that the limit space N-infinity = ($)under-left-arrow lim N-A is homotopy equivalent to X. A connection with cell structures [2], [3] is discussed. (C) 2021 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: MEAN DIMENSION OF SHIFTS OF FINITE TYPE AND OF GENERALIZED INVERSE LIMITS
paper_title.ja: MEAN DIMENSION OF SHIFTS OF FINITE TYPE AND OF GENERALIZED INVERSE LIMITS

description.ja: We study mean dimension of shifts of finite type defined on compact metric spaces and give its lower bound when the shift possesses a certain "periodic block" of arbitrarily large length. The result is applied to shift maps on generalized inverse limits with upper semi-continuous closed set-valued functions. In particular we obtain a refinement of some results due to Banic [1] and Erceg and Kennedy [5] on the dimension of the inverse limit spaces and topological entropy of their shifts.
description.en: We study mean dimension of shifts of finite type defined on compact metric spaces and give its lower bound when the shift possesses a certain "periodic block" of arbitrarily large length. The result is applied to shift maps on generalized inverse limits with upper semi-continuous closed set-valued functions. In particular we obtain a refinement of some results due to Banic [1] and Erceg and Kennedy [5] on the dimension of the inverse limit spaces and topological entropy of their shifts.

paper_title.ja: A Banach-Stone Theorem and topological dimension
paper_title.en: A Banach-Stone Theorem and topological dimension
POINT DERIVATIONS AND COHOMOLOGIES OF LIPSCHITZ ALGEBRAS
paper_title.ja: POINT DERIVATIONS AND COHOMOLOGIES OF LIPSCHITZ ALGEBRAS

description.en: For a compact metric space (K, d), LipK denotes the Banach algebra of all complex-valued Lipschitz functions on (K, d). We show that the continuous Hochschild cohomology H-n(LipK, (LipK)*) and H-n(LipK, C-e) are both infinite-dimensional vector spaces for each n >= 1 if the space K contains a certain infinite sequence which converges to a point e is an element of K. Here (LipK)* is the dual module of LipK and C-e denotes the complex numbers with a LipK-bimodule structure defined by evaluations of LipK-functions at e. Examples of such metric spaces include all compact Riemannian manifolds, compact geodesic metric spaces and infinite compact subsets of R. In particular, the (small) global homological dimension of LipK is infinite for every such space. Our proof uses the description of point derivations by Sherbert ['The structure of ideals and point derivations in Banach algebras of Lipschitz functions', Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. 111 (1964), 240-272] and directly constructs non-trivial cocycles with the help of alternating cocycles of Johnson ['Higher-dimensional weak amenability', Studia Math. 123 (1997), 117-134]. An alternating construction of cocycles on the basis of the idea of Kleshchev ['Homological dimension of Banach algebras of smooth functions is equal to infinity', Vest. Math. Mosk. Univ. Ser. 1. Mat. Mech. 6 (1988), 57-60] is also discussed.
description.ja: For a compact metric space (K, d), LipK denotes the Banach algebra of all complex-valued Lipschitz functions on (K, d). We show that the continuous Hochschild cohomology H-n(LipK, (LipK)*) and H-n(LipK, C-e) are both infinite-dimensional vector spaces for each n >= 1 if the space K contains a certain infinite sequence which converges to a point e is an element of K. Here (LipK)* is the dual module of LipK and C-e denotes the complex numbers with a LipK-bimodule structure defined by evaluations of LipK-functions at e. Examples of such metric spaces include all compact Riemannian manifolds, compact geodesic metric spaces and infinite compact subsets of R. In particular, the (small) global homological dimension of LipK is infinite for every such space. Our proof uses the description of point derivations by Sherbert ['The structure of ideals and point derivations in Banach algebras of Lipschitz functions', Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. 111 (1964), 240-272] and directly constructs non-trivial cocycles with the help of alternating cocycles of Johnson ['Higher-dimensional weak amenability', Studia Math. 123 (1997), 117-134]. An alternating construction of cocycles on the basis of the idea of Kleshchev ['Homological dimension of Banach algebras of smooth functions is equal to infinity', Vest. Math. Mosk. Univ. Ser. 1. Mat. Mech. 6 (1988), 57-60] is also discussed.

paper_title.en: Derivations and cohomologies of Lipschitz algebras
paper_title.ja: Derivations and cohomologies of Lipschitz algebras

description.ja: For a compact metric space (M, d), LipM denotes the Banach algebra of all complex-valued Lipschitz functions on (M, d). Motivated by a classical result of de Leeuw, we give a canonical construction of a compact Hausdorff space (M) over cap and a continuous surjection pi : (M) over cap -> M which may viewed as a metric analogue of the unit sphere bundle over a Riemannian manifold. It is shownthat, for each n >= 1 the continuous Hochschild cohomology H-n(LipM, C((M) over cap)) has the infinite rank as a LipM-module, if the metric space (M, d) admits a local geodesic structure, for example, if M is a compact Riemannian manifold or a non-positively curved metric space. Here C((M) over cap) denotes the algebra of all complex-valued continuous functions on (M) over cap. On the other hand, if the coefficient C((M) over cap) is replaced with C(M), then it is shown that H-1(LipM, C(M)) = 0 for each compact Lipschitz manifold M.
description.en: For a compact metric space (M, d), LipM denotes the Banach algebra of all complex-valued Lipschitz functions on (M, d). Motivated by a classical result of de Leeuw, we give a canonical construction of a compact Hausdorff space (M) over cap and a continuous surjection pi : (M) over cap -> M which may viewed as a metric analogue of the unit sphere bundle over a Riemannian manifold. It is shownthat, for each n >= 1 the continuous Hochschild cohomology H-n(LipM, C((M) over cap)) has the infinite rank as a LipM-module, if the metric space (M, d) admits a local geodesic structure, for example, if M is a compact Riemannian manifold or a non-positively curved metric space. Here C((M) over cap) denotes the algebra of all complex-valued continuous functions on (M) over cap. On the other hand, if the coefficient C((M) over cap) is replaced with C(M), then it is shown that H-1(LipM, C(M)) = 0 for each compact Lipschitz manifold M.

paper_title.ja: Hermitian operators and isometries on injective tensor products of uniform algebras and C*-algebras

paper_title.en: APPROXIMATE AMENABILITY AND A VARIANT OF CONTINUOUS HOCHSCHILD COHOMOLOGY
paper_title.ja: APPROXIMATE AMENABILITY AND A VARIANT OF CONTINUOUS HOCHSCHILD COHOMOLOGY

description.ja: We study a variant of continuous Hochschild cohomology of a Banach algebra in connection with a higher-dimensional analogue of the approximate amenability of the algebra. Some results on higher-dimensional amenability have natural analogues in our context. Alternating cocycles, due to Johnson [18], are studied, and a previous result of the author [17] on Lipschitz algebras over compact metric spaces is improved.
description.en: We study a variant of continuous Hochschild cohomology of a Banach algebra in connection with a higher-dimensional analogue of the approximate amenability of the algebra. Some results on higher-dimensional amenability have natural analogues in our context. Alternating cocycles, due to Johnson [18], are studied, and a previous result of the author [17] on Lipschitz algebras over compact metric spaces is improved.

paper_title.ja: A Banach Stone type theorem for C1-function spaces over the circle
paper_title.en: A Banach Stone type theorem for C1-function spaces over the circle
Shift maps and their variants on inverse limits with set-valued functions

description.en: Inverse limit spaces of compacta with upper semi-continuous compact set-valued functions are studied via shift maps and their variants. We give a representation of such spaces as the limits of ordinary inverse sequences, which allows us to prove some known results and their extensions in a unified scheme. Next we present a scheme to construct shift dynamics on the inverse limit space with various dynamical features. In particular we construct an inverse sequence over [0,1] with a single upper semi-continuous function f as its bonding function such that (i) the inverse limit space [0,1]f is homeomorphic to the Cantor set and (ii) the shift map σf:[0,1]f→[0,1]f is topologically conjugate to a minimal subshift of a Bernoulli full shift. Also we study local/global connectivity of the inverse limit space over a compactum with a single upper semi-continuous bonding function in terms of homotopy/(co)homology groups, again via shift maps and their variants.

paper_title.en: Isometries of vector-valued function spaces preserving the kernel of a linear operator

description.en: We prove Banach-Stone type theorems for isometries of continuously differentiable (continuously twice differentiable resp.) functions on the unit interval equipped with norms related to the first derivative (a linear differential operator of second-order resp.). They are consequences of a general theorem on isometries of function spaces, on which a linear operator is defined, over compact Hausdorff spaces.

publisher.en: University of Debrecen, Institute of Mathematics

paper_title.ja: Perturbations of norms on C1 function spaces and associated isometry groups
paper_title.en: Perturbations of norms on C1 function spaces and associated isometry groups
Norms on C1([0, 1]) and their isometries

description.en: We present a unified framework to study isometries, with respect to various norms, on C1([0, 1]), the space of continuously first differentiable functions on the unit interval [0, 1]. We also discuss continuous deformations of isometry groups induced by perturbations of norms on C1([0, 1]).
